HelpXML.Title: OPTpsix
HelpXML.Purpose: OPTpsix computes psi function (derivative of rho function) times x

Item.Name: u
Item.LongDesc: n x 1 vector containing residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample

Item.Name: c
Item.LongDesc: Scalar greater than 0 which controls the robustness/efficiency of the estimator (beta in regression or mu in the location case ...)

Item.Name: psix
Item.TypeInd: Values of the derivative of the optimal psi function multiplied by u, associated to the residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample.

HelpXML.MoreAbout:
Function OPTpsix transforms vector u as follows
\[ OPTpsix(u,c) = \left\{ \begin{array}{cc} \frac{1}{3.25*c^2} u^2 & |u| \leq 2c \\
(1/3.25) * (-1.944 * \frac{u^2}{c^2} + 1.728 \frac{u^4}{c^4} - 0.312 \frac{x^6}{c^6} + 0.016 \frac{x^8}{c^8} & \qquad 2c \leq |u| \leq 3c \\
0 & |u|>3c \\ \end{array} \right. \]
Remark: function $\psi(x) *x$ has been precalculated because it is used to find the weights in case of Tau estimators

References.Item: Maronna, R.A., Martin D. and Yohai V.J. (2006), Robust Statistics, Theory and Methods, Wiley, New York.
